review_title: Do Not Take A Travel Contract Here/License Is At Risk
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Cypress, TX
pros: Meeting other travel nurses who are going through the same ordeal you are.
cons: Toxic work culture. Travel nurses, the pay is outstanding here for a reason. DO NOT, I Repeat, DO NOT take a travel contract here. They are run by HCA, an extremely greedy hospital corporation indicted for Medicare care fraud twice now. This particular hospital has been sued multiple times now. Google it. Stay far away!!!

pros: Good benefits, flexible schedule. Understanding manager.
cons: Not enough paid leave for my taste.

pros: Good teamwork, good benefits, opportunities to grow from within,
cons: lower base pay, long hours

review_title: If you want to advance seek employment elsewhere
pros: I was able to connect with patients and coworkers and make lifelong friendships
cons: Low pay, no room for advancement, and management is not concerned. In a majority of the departments several people are more qualified and educated then their boss. Managers will also deny your request to transferor no reason. Also the health insurance is pretty exclusive to that hospital if you want things covered.

review_title: North Cypress Medical Center is a good place to jump start your career but not for longevity and growth.
pros: It's a good hospital to jump start your career.
cons: People are not compensated fairly and are not rewarded for their hard work.

pros: Easy commute and parking privileges.
cons:
The majority of the issues stemmed from the leadership and the cliques formed; if you don't fit their narrative, you will be met with reprisal. 
Discrimination was direct and obvious, especially within the upper echelon.
This medical center does not focus on patient care, as they claim, but on how much they can swindle out of you.
Services are excessively overcharged and patient care is lacking.

pros: The nurses are awesome and really work together as a team. Charting is a breeze and doesn't take nearly as long as most hospitals. Utilizing PTO is no problem and you accumulate PTO quickly.
cons: Doctors talk down to nurses, the pay isn't that great, the tuition reimbursement is extremely low, and there's not much positive reinforcement.

pros: Nice People, fast pace environment, overtime is always available! There are always opportunities to move to different departments and learn new material.
cons: I wish they pay was a little more. Compare to other hospitals, we are compensated less for the same amount of work. I am not too happy about that.

review_title: Great place of work, interesting time during the buyout
pros: It was a great company where I could really thrive and become immersed in a rehab setting. Management was stellar
cons: When we got bought out by HCA, it became all about productivity. For the business it was good, for the employee it was not the most fun.

pros: Very close to home. Wonderful physicians to work with.
cons: Poor Management and time scheduling. Rarely given lunch breaks. No "Team" building or promoting of it. Bias scheduling, not all employees maintained full time hours while others were offered overtime even if it wasn't needed

pros: Great management team and work environment.  The management staff is thoughtful and want to see you succeed.
cons: Low pay and limited overtime opportunities.  The blue suits we are required to wear are dreadful.

pros: Great place to learn. Many Classes and training opportunities are offered.
cons: Cafeteria only open a few hours. Sketchy policy/procedure process. Scheduling process a mess. Much preferential treatment there

pros: transport team is really nice.
cons: Everything else.  Staff is unfriendly,  and if you are not clinical; youre not important
